html: Thanks to these emails, we now know Ross’s testimony was false. As I said on the Senate Floor this week, Ross is not an investment banker anymore. He must answer to Congress & the American people. Hiding will not solve his problems. The truth has a way of catching up.

html: Senator Patrick Leahy, one of the Democratic negotiators, isn't waiting to hear whether Trump will sign Congress's budget bill. "No! We're an independent body. We're the ones who do spending bills. If the White House doesn't like it, fine, veto it."
text:
Senator Patrick Leahy, one of the Democratic negotiators, isn't waiting to hear whether Trump will sign Congress's budget bill.

"No! We're an independent body. We're the ones who do spending bills. If the White House doesn't like it, fine, veto it."

html: On the reopening the government, Democratic Senator Pat Leahy tells me, “We had it all worked out in December, and the irony is eventually that’s probably what we’ll go back to.” Says federal employees forced to work without pay only to reach the same deal “a double tragedy.”
text: On the reopening the government, Democratic Senator Pat Leahy tells me, “We had it all worked out in December, and the irony is eventually that’s probably what we’ll go back to.” Says federal employees forced to work without pay only to reach the same deal “a double tragedy.”

html: #FACT: The Trump Administration has only spent 6 percent – SIX PERCENT – of the $1.7 billion the Congress has appropriated over the last two years to build or replace fencing on the southern border. That does not sound like an urgent need for additional billions in funding.
text: #FACT: The Trump Administration has only spent 6 percent – SIX PERCENT – of the $1.7 billion the Congress has appropriated over the last two years to build or replace fencing on the southern border. That does not sound like an urgent need for additional billions in funding.

html: #FACT: Border fencing construction is not “under budget.” The largest stretch of fencing that Congress has funded, a 25 mile barrier in the Rio Grande Valley, has ballooned in cost, from $445 to $787 million – a price tag of $31.5 million per mile for taxpayers.
text: #FACT: Border fencing construction is not “under budget.” The largest stretch of fencing that Congress has funded, a 25 mile barrier in the Rio Grande Valley, has ballooned in cost, from $445 to $787 million – a price tag of $31.5 million per mile for taxpayers.
